boardgame.name: Greyburgh Market
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

"Come one, come all, come fat, come small, we’ve wares to sell and dreams to weave, desires to stoke, and ailments to balm. You there! Stride no further into the market! First, harken to me! Close your eyes, traveller, just trust me, I’ll not steal from you. Good, now imagine what you seek, anything, even if it has never existed - a bauble conjured purely from your most fevered dreams… now open your eyes. I guarantee you’ll find it here in Greyburgh... it’s all a matter of seeking. But some seek day and night, for years even! First they lose their way among the labyrinthine shops and stalls, then they lose their purse, then their teeth, then their mind.

The market can be a harsh mistress, friend, but fear not, you’ve me to guide you. I swear I’ll see you to your heart’s desire and safely out again… for the right price… everything here in Greyburgh is up for sale… if you are willing to pay the fee.”
- Graemin Satterlay,
Greyburgh Market Barker and Lantern Guide

boardgame.name: Lock 'N Load Tactical: Hell Frozen Over – X-Maps
boardgame.description:
X-Maps are larger maps and are the same as the standard maps in every way except they are comprised of larger hexes, which contain nearly twice the areas of the standard hexes. X-Maps are 11" x 17" inches contrast to the 8.25" x 12.75: dimensions of the standard maps.

To use the Hell Frozen Over X-Maps you must have the Hell Frozen Over expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Hell Frozen Over

boardgame.name: Imperial Dossier: House Hawkwood
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
The Lion Roars
House Hawkwood saw one of its own become emperor, only to be sidelined by Alexius in his bid to win the favor of all the Royal Houses. No matter. The Hawkwoods have remained ever stoic and unyielding before the tides of time and trouble. After withstanding years of raids by the Vuldrok, it is their turn to expand into the barbarians' worlds and take back their lost glory.
Includes: The Nobility, a primer on noble titles, inheritance, and holdings for all of the Known Worlds' noble houses, major and minor.

The Imperial Dossier series examines in-depth the main factions of the Fading Suns universe. Each book serves as a primer on a single faction, commissioned by the empire for its diplomats, bureaucrats, soldiers, star-sailors, Questing Knights, and their Cohorts, with commentary from the Imperial Eye. Each book also includes a "factbook" about a topic closely related to the dossier's faction, and a rules section that includes new callings, perks, equipment, and even alien creatures.

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load: Noville – Bastogne's Outpost: X-Maps
boardgame.description:
X-Maps are larger maps and are the same as the standard maps in every way except they are comprised of larger hexes, which contain nearly twice the areas of the standard hexes. X-Maps are 11" x 17" inches contrast to the 8.25" x 12.75: dimensions of the standard maps.

To use the Noville – Bastogne's Outpost X-Maps you must have the Noville – Bastogne's Outpost expansion.

Includes:
14 Geomorphic X-Maps (six single-sided and four double-sided)
Player Aid Card

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of Normandy – 4K X-Maps
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

4K X-Maps are actually two products in one. X-Maps bring the Lock ‘n Load Tactical series games to a grander scale, with a substantially larger playing surface and hexes that are nearly double those of the standard maps. In comparison, X-Maps are 11” x 17” as opposed to the 8.25” x 12.75” standard maps.

What Does the 4K Element Add?

4K adds to our X-Maps in many ways starting with our new map style that uses a much more minimal hex grid design. It also includes more custom map terrain and buildings giving each map its own style. We also use a much more minimal hex grid design that shows less hex grid and more map. You will, of course, receive all the original maps that are included in the game (Heroes of Normandy as an example) and some additional maps all in this new style. Some of the scenarios require you to pretend certain terrain or features of the map are not there or are to be exchanged with other types of terrain. A scenario might say "All fields are to be considered Clear terrain etc." For those scenarios, we have made new maps that already have the terrain changed. We also have a list of the scenarios that states which map to substitute, allowing the player to be more immersed in the game. These maps are NOT needed to play your games but are an enhancement for them.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of Normandy

boardgame.name: ドルフィーファイブ (Dolphy Five)
boardgame.description:
Dolphy Five is a dice game that produces dolphins in a certain aquarium. Become a trainer and raise your own idols. There are 30 types of individuality in all. A gentleman's dollar trip, a chara Paris pilka, a brutal idol fin ...

Every time you play, a wide variety of dolphins are born! Make full use of the effects of the helping animals to outperform your rivals and aim to become the No. 1 dolphin!

boardgame.name: Drinks & Daggers: Expansion – Allies
boardgame.description:
Allies, the first expansion for Drinks & Daggers adds 4 heroes and 1 boss deck to the Drinks & Daggers co-operative card game. This cooperative, "drinking" card game brings the world and characters of the podcast Greetings Adventurers (previously Drunks & Dragons) to the table top.

Heroes: Yazdir, Zird, Bucky, Frank
Boss: Finnekan

boardgame.name: Small Railroad Empires: Custom Wooden Tracks
boardgame.description:
Deluxe Wooden Tracks for Small Railroad Empires including 115 custom wooden tracks (23 for each of the 5 player colors).

This is a kickstarter exclusive item.

boardgame.name: 蒼天之死 (Death of Heaven)
boardgame.description:
For years, the Han Empire and its authority has been weakening. Most of the governing warlords would rather increase their own personal military strength rather than restore power to the Han. The Yellow Turban Rebellion has long since passed, yet whispers of rebellion have grown louder and louder over time. The land is at the brink of war.

Death of Heaven is a negotiation & area control game for 4 to 6 players. Players are warlords at the end of the Han Dynasty competing to become Emperor. Players spread their influence across the land. They can choose to defend their own cities, ally with NPC forces, or support the Han emperor; each giving their own rewards and bonuses. When a battle does occur between two players, the other players must choose to either support the attacking or defending side of the battle.

Outmaneuver your opponents, cut off their support lines, and squeeze. Loosen your silver tongue and negotiate your way out of defeat, turning the tables against your foe at the perfect time. Many paths to victory lay ahead of you. Will you restore power to the Han Empire or sail to victory on the blood of your enemies?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

boardgame.name: Aquarena
boardgame.description:
Countryside ponds are little slices of paradise where everything is calm and peaceful. Or so it seems... For pond’s people, this poetic backdrop represents a daily struggle for survival, where it’s “eat or be eaten”!

Aquarena shows us what the food chain near a pond looks like. Carefully position your predators around the pond, so they can catch their favorite prey. But beware: they too can fall prey to other predators.


A game takes place over 4 rounds, each of which consists of 3 successive phases: Planning, Resolution and Scoring.


Planning phase: beginning with the starting player and then in clockwise order, players choose 1 card from their hand which they place on the edge of a Water tile of their choice, discard 1 other card from their hand and draw 2 new cards. Players continue taking turns until they have played 4 cards: the first 2 cards are placed face up and the last 2 cards are placed face down.
Resolution phase: the starting player chooses one Water tile and reveals the face-down Predator cards that were placed on it. All cards on the tile are resolved in numerical order, from 1 to 10. When all Predator cards on the tile have been resolved, the next player in clockwise order chooses another Water tile to resolve. Continue like this until all Water tiles have been resolved.
Scoring phase: players move their Frog meeple a number of spaces up the score track depending on how many flies and opponent preys they caught.


The game ends after the fourth round. The player with the most victory points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Magical Star Bakery
まじかる☆ベーカリー 今日から財閥っ (Magical ☆ Bakery: A conglomerate from today)
boardgame.description:
Build up your conglomerate of shops that will propel you to victory

Each turn, players use dice and resources to build buildings that offer them various rewards to help them progress their conglomerate. Once a player reaches 20 points, the last round is triggered, and the player with the most points is the winner

The game revolves around resource gathering, clever combo creation (using the buildings), and dice manipulation to help you to be the ultimate victor

Players receive 2 dice (one character ability gets 3 dice)
They then use the dice to either take a card, or roll the dice to use the number to build a card
They can also use a dice to gather resources
Some buildings let them change / manipulate the dice values.

boardgame.name: Imperial Dossier: Urth Orthodox
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
The Law of Heaven
Priests of the Orthodoxy - from the ostentatious biships of the capital cities to the humble parish priests in the most poverty-stricken fiefs - are found throughout the Known Worlds. While this ruling sect of the Universal Church has gained a reputation for cunning political maneuvers, most of its priests know little of such things, being entirely too busy protecting the souls of the simple faithful. While many may spurn the Orthodoxy for its overtly political role, when tragedy strikes, it is the Orthodoxy they return to for consolation.

Includes: Theology, a primer on Church cosmology and scripture across all sects and orders.

The Imperial Dossier series examines in-depth the main factions of the Fading Suns universe. Each book serves as a primer on a single faction, commissioned by the empire for its diplomats, bureaucrats, soldiers, star-sailors, Questing Knights, and their Cohorts, with commentary from the Imperial Eye. Each book also includes a "factbook" about a topic closely related to the dossier's faction, and a rules section that includes new callings, perks, equipment, and even alien creatures.

boardgame.name: Omny
boardgame.description:
Introduction

Omny is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of a finite, initially empty patch of a hexagonal tiling. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



Definitions

A group is a set of mutually adjacent stones of the same color.

A cut of a group is a set of mutually adjacent cells (empty or occupied by either color) including no stones in that group.



Play

Before the game starts, some cells on the board are designated as star cells.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell.

You win by making a group of your color such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board.



Komi and pie rule

Komi or the pie rule (or both) can be used in order to make the game fair.

The pie rule gives White the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

Komi is either a whole number or a whole number plus 0.5. When komi is used, Black wins by making a black group such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board minus komi, and White wins by making a white group such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board plus komi. Komi works best when the number of star cells is fairly large.

Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games. When komi and the pie rule are used together, Black on their first turn chooses komi and places a black stone on the board, and then White has the option to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



Notes

Races (but not draws) are possible when the sum of the number of star cells and twice the value of komi is an even number.

Different board shapes and star cell configurations result in different games:


Sunder: The perimeter of the board is a regular hexagon. All cells on the board are star cells.



Y: The perimeter of the board is an equilateral triangle. The three corner cells of the board are star cells.



Gyre: The perimeter of the board is a regular hexagon. The center cell and all perimeter cells are star cells.



Free Y: The perimeter of the board is an irregular hexagon with an odd number of cells. All perimeter cells are star cells.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Allikroko
boardgame.description:
The little crocodiles need fish and want to be fed. So mama croc swims in the river and catches fish. The fish are placed in three corners of the water surface, the crocodile in the fourth - then the player on the turn carefully moves the box with the water surface. If Allikroko slips into the hole in the middle, the so-called whirlpool, then he catches fish under his mouth - and by the number of fish caught, the crocodile stone on the score card may be moved forward. For the next player the game is prepared again. The first player to reach the top square of the score card wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wer nicht bauen kann, muß...
boardgame.description:
The players have the task of building a house of cards without letting it collapse. The player whose turn it is draws 2 cards, 1 neutral and 1 penalty card. If he can fit both cards into the house of cards without an accident, it is the next player's turn. However, if the house of cards collapses, he must carry out the penalty of the penalty card just drawn, e.g. refill each player's drink, or sing a song etc. The execution of the punishment is judged by the other players and the punished person receives 1 to 3 minus points. Alternatively, you can buy your way out of the penalty with cash, but you will receive 5 minus points. Once a player has accumulated 10 minus points, the player with the fewest minus points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Würfelbilder
boardgame.description:
36 playing cards are laid out in 6 stacks sorted by numbers. Each player may roll the dice up to 2 times in his turn and tries to get one of the numbered cards with the result (for a rolled 1 and 6, the card 16 or 61 can be taken). If he succeeds, he receives chips corresponding to the card. If it fails, he loses a chip. If the last card is rolled, the player with the most chips wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Komplett verrückt!
boardgame.description:
Each player receives a 5x5 board, on which 24 square tiles in six colors are somehow colorfully distributed, as well as a so-called "pattern mixer". This hides behind a plexiglass housing nine small cubes, which must be shaken neatly. In this way, each player receives a task: 3x3 colors arranged in a very specific way.

The task now is to achieve exactly this arrangement at the middle 3x3 squares by moving the tiles on your own game board. The outer ring, which still comprises 20 squares, plays no role and is easily hidden by the slightly milky cover anyway. Of course, the winner is the one who could solve his task first.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Symphonia
boardgame.description:
Embody a violinist and awake a gigantic, forsaken world in this highly poetic platformer! Using your violin and bow, move towards the core of the realm to understand your role in this universe and play the best Concerto!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: WeyKick Piccolo
boardgame.description: A fast paced soccer game for 2 players. Each player takes control of 1 footballer by moving magnets below the wooden playing table. The footballers themselves are magnetic and move in response. The players try to kick a small marble ball into their opponent's goal. The first player to score ten goals wins.

listing.notes:
Game: Weykick Piccolo (Weyel Games) incl. 4 Janosch figurines and 2 balls Condition: new, unplayed Language: language independentt
Thanks in advance for ordering!
See seller info for information on shipping, payment & cancellation.

boardgame.name: Tohaa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the Tohaa Trinomial, the most noble empire in existence! Welcome, friend. Everything we do, we do to reach Exaltation. Anything else is unimportant!

We are the children of Unification, standing together and sailing through the stars, colonizing planets and bringing their wealth of knowledge to the less sophisticated. Sharing our knowledge where possible and destroying those who would oppose it.

Centuries of exploration and a constant thirst for knowledge have made the Tohaa the greatest civilization in the galaxy, sailing across the galaxy in vast Errant Fleets searching for life and knowledge, using their astounding understanding of biotechnology to touch and influence native species with enough potential to help them in their endeavor to share in the secrets of the universe.

Terraforming and life hacking are some of the gifts the Tohaa bring those deserving them. Highly adaptive and extremely intelligent, they coldly study and evaluate each race they encounter, gauging their potential for Exaltation, the process in which they will become an auxiliary species for the Tohaa’s plans.

The Tohaa Sourcebook includes:

The origins of the Tohaa Trinomial, the only race in the Universe to survive the onslaught of the Evolved Intelligence and their bloodthirsty Combined Army!
Rules and guidelines to play Tohaa and the exalted races of auxiliary aliens! Chaksa, Koldinuk, and more!
Biotechnologies! Nothing defines the Tohaa quite as well as their ability to create living technologies to enhance their everyday life, their scientific endeavours, and their warriors.
Everything your triad will need, from Corahtaa disciplines to symbioweapons and armour!
Ideas on how to run a Tohaa-centred campaign in the Human Sphere! From the Colonial Territories, Errant Fleets, or the bloody and cruel clash between Triumvirate and the traitorous Sygmaa Trihedron — let those primitive humans fight among themselves while the superior technologies and disciplines of the Trinomial carry the day!

boardgame.name: Die Kugelbox
boardgame.description:
The further apart the balls are, the more points
points (distance between the balls or the area that is formed).Up to 25 points with one throw are possible.

The box contains 2 types of games:

Chikugo
A ball in which the goal is to get as few chips as possible
or to get rid of them as quickly as possible...

Steal Exactly
Ball game where the goal is to get to collect chips with as high values as possible and to or to steal them from other players...

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Kalunga Plateau: Issue 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hidden in the depths of the most secluded jungle is a plateau dominated by monstrous beasts and primal tribes. This placeholds uncountable amounts of gems, gold and silver within long forgotten caverns, protected by reptilian monsters, humanoid beings and powerful shamans. Are you brave enough to explore the Kalunga Plateau?

This product is an unoficial module for Old School Essentials, and it is compatible with pretty much most OSR games. It is a
toolkit containing:

A setting.
Rules for character creation.
A list of new spells.
An adventure.

boardgame.name: Leopard Women of Venus Pre-Kickstarter Preview!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Leopard Women of Venus is the lurid, over-the-top campaign setting that you've always wanted! Inspired by the grotesque fantasies of Golden Age comic book great Fletcher Hanks, Leopard Women of Venus brings to life the pulp science fiction fantasies of a bygone age, with a modern twist.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Ultra
boardgame.description:
Ultra is a 2-player game in which each player tries to be the first to establish a connection between the opposite sides of the board. This connection, a kind of thought wave, is composed of up to 24 stones in 5 types.

—user summary

Payment via PayPal or bank transfer. If you pay via PayPal, please use the button “Send to friends abroad”, then there are no fees. ... Thanks!!

We offer in our "Modern Second-Hand-Games-Shop" on our private homepage www.alte-spiele.de/antiquar.html more than 4.000 other games: older one, newer one, rare one and little known one. The offer consists of titles since the 1970s and mainly in German-speaking. Just look once over with us.

boardgame.name: Ravenloft Bestiary: Monsters of the Ravenloft Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Dread Domains!

They lurk in the shadows. They linger in your dreams. They come under the cover of darkness. They are the foul creatures that dwell in Ravenloft, the mysterious Demiplane of Dread, and they are waiting for you. From the dreamstalking bastellus to the body-snatching doppelgänger plant, this horrific tome contains a great assortment of creatures that will haunt the nightmares of your players and player characters for years to come.

boardgame.name: Dark Stalker
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The difference between what you will find in these pages and the solo system presented in Appendix O of the Dark Streets & Darker Secrets rules is the definition of ‘solo.’ The rules in Appendix O refer to solo as being one GM and one player. A group that doesn’t have the back up of an entire party of characters, with their range of skills and abilities.

The solo that this book deals with is true solo or solitaire play. These rules dispense with the GM and replace that role with a few random tables and improvisational prompts.

boardgame.name: Raffinesse
boardgame.description:
Advertising game for the company "Miele". In this cooking-themed game, the players have to gather the ingredients for one of three recipes as quickly as possible, making sure that no superfluous part is included. The game piece is moved with dice, the event fields are completed accordingly.

Note: This game contains a recipe book whose recipes were developed directly in the Miele test kitchen.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Star-Reporter
boardgame.description:
Players try to bring the best stories and collect money for them. After several rounds, the first player to earn 40,000 wins.
There are reporters, reports and documents cards, as well as play money cards. Everyone gets starting capital and 8 cards. Series of 3 cards must be formed, always with the same suit and within one category. The player on the turn takes a card and offers a card for auction, whoever buys it pays and gets the card, or the card is rejected by all. Actually, you may only buy a card to complete a series, but you can bluff, whoever is caught pays penalty and the purchase price. Whoever is the first to present 3 combinations with 3 cards, with documents with consecutive numbers, wins a round and receives bonuses paid by his fellow players. The possession of each player is noted and a new round begins with new starting capital and 8 cards.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Band on the Run
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Neon & Noqual, an up-and-coming “stardock rock” band, isn’t well known outside of its small but loyal fan base. When an opportunity arises for the band to play at a music festival, the musicians jump at the chance. Unfortunately, luck isn’t on their side. They are going to need their wits, skills, and musical talent to make it to the show in time for their chance to make it big!

User summary:

For 4th-level characters; pre-generated characters, organized play tracking sheets, and art assets are available for this scenario.

boardgame.name: Young Adult RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Young Adult RPG is a game of encountering the unknown for the first time. You will create a palace where your characters live. In this palace you will see into the characters' everyday lives. Then your characters will encounter something strange, out of the ordinary, and this will thrust them into a world where they must confront the unknown. Much of the game involves using your imagination to take things from the first, "ordinary" part of the game and transfigure them into something new and Strange. Doing this will reward the players, allowing their characters to progress, and drive the story of each character and her friends to its inevitable conclusion. These stories can be about reveling in the strange, or fighting against it. If you'd like to, you can even make a sad story. That is completely up to you and the friends you play with. No matter what ending you reach, memory will be the currency you use to get there.

boardgame.name: What Remains: A Game About Memory
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this cooperative storytelling game, players take on the roles of archeologists — or maybe angels— exploring the ruined landscape of a life. Using the objects they come across, they attempt to discover and recreate the memories of this life, finding moments and impressions in a broken flowerpot, the hum of the refrigerator, or the fleeting line of a song. Will the wind carry them away, or will they find out what remains?
boardgame.rpg: What Remains: A Game About Memory

boardgame.name: Hypodroid
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hypodroids, androids without the ability to form memories, roam a landscape of ruin. Stuck between an overlord class of true androids and a slave class of man, the hypodroids fight amongst themselves for what power lies within their grasp. You are a hypodroid, recently activated and let loose on a world that doesn’t need you. Do you embrace society or try to destroy it?

boardgame.name: In the Beginning
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the beginning, God created the Heavens and the Earth... then took the rest of eternity off.

To maintain the new Creation, a hierarchy of celestial beings was established: angels and archangels, Powers, Virtues, Dominions, Ophanim, Cherubim - and finally the Seraphim, whose task it was to sing constant praise for the Creator, lest insecurity and self-doubt overwhelm the Creation and unweave the carefully-arranged threads of reality.

After several eons of "Holy, holy, holy! Hosanna! Hosanna!", though, Creation seemed fairly confident, and everyone involved was getting pretty sick of the whole thing. It was decided by all that the old songs would be retired, and strong new musics brought up to replace them, as was only fit and right. But how to determine which songs were best? How to determine which singers would best perform the Hymns, and which had become redundant? Behold the wisdom of the Creator: there would be a contest.

The seraph best able to reflect the glory of Creation would be granted the beautiful, undying flower that grew at the right hand of the Throne - the Rose Amaranth - as well as the honor of remaining in its position. The other seraphim would be demoted to the lower ranks of angels, to do whatever it was that the lower ranks did. (Probably washing other angels' feet, or something.) Because the seraphim possessed endless grace and unreproachable integrity, they would serve not only as competitors but as judges, deciding amongst themselves which seraph would best praise the Creator and His works. They would, of course, do so with the dignity and honesty that characterized a servant of the Most High.

boardgame.name: Rule the Waves
boardgame.description:
Rule the Waves is a 1-2 player co-operative game where you take command of the British Empire's Royal Navy in the 17th and 18th century. In the 1 player game you can take command of either one or two ships (depending on difficulty) and follow some of the most dangerous sea journeys of the time. Enemies such as Dutch, French and Spanish ships will stand in your way, alongside the most famous pirates ever to sail the seas.

The aim is simple! Destroy all of those in the way and make it back still afloat. Management of HP and ammunition will be key towards the decisions needed to be made on the way.

There are 5 journeys in total in the single player (3 in the two player), and your level of success will depend on the amount of foes you defeat whilst completing those journeys. On each journey there are 7 positions, at each position you draw a card. This card is most likely to be one of your enemies to defeat. Do this by deciding how much ammunition you want to shoot with and rolling for success. If they aren't sunk already your enemies will fight back! This happens at each position of the journey until you complete the 7th step. If you are still in one piece then you have been successful. The game ends when all of the journey are completed and you have made it back alive. How do you win? Firstly, a basic win is that you have been able to get through the journeys and made them all home successfully. On top of that you may be in for recognition, depending on how many foes you have defeated, especially those pirates lurking in your way.

—description from the designer

listing.notes: My own game produced and copied. These will be sent out in the component burlap bag with two dice, hearts, crates and three cubes for play. Shipping in the UK is £4.

boardgame.name: Shamanal
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Gods who have forgotten what they are and have trapped themselves in dream worlds of their own design.

User summary:

The game uses an unusual D10 - D6 (D10 minus D6) action resolution method.

boardgame.name: ME-MORY
boardgame.description: In this game you match photos of landmarks of the German city of Mettmann from past times to the more current view of the same place. The game mechanism is the same as in the classic memory game, but each pair consists of two different photos: a current one and an older one.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Hollow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You and your mouse friends have escaped the King’s Pleasure Palace where giant braziers of smoking embers have clouded your head and erased your long-term memories. Now you must remember who you were and what you were once good at to survive in The Hollow.

boardgame.name: What Next?
boardgame.description:
Introducing What Next, the brand new 'Pick-Your-Path' adventure game where you never know what's waiting around the corner. Could be a gigantic koala, a fleet of rampaging robots or an old lady with a rocket launcher — there's just no telling.

Working together with the rest of the players, your goal is to navigate your way through the adventure, conquer any obstacle you encounter and make it to the end in one piece. Oh. and you'll want to keep an eye on that Tower of Peril too. Let it topple before you reach the end and it'll be game over for everyone.

Unlike most adventure games, What Next isn't just about picking the right path. Buried inside these adventures, you'll find over 60 dexterity challenges, each one designed to stop you dead In your tracks. Want to grab a vine and swing from the trees? You'll need to throw a card into the air and catch it first. Decide to walk over that old rope bridge? Well, first you'll need to flick the wooden puck across the table, without it falling off. It's important to master every mini-game you come across in these adventures — or you might not make it to the finish line.

The players turn over the next location card, read out the story and then choose which path to take next. If there is an event, the player reading the card must complete the dexterity challenge.

The game ends when either the players reach the end of the adventure (win), or the tower of peril collapses (lose).

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Only one scenario has been opened and played through

Complete game in great condition. Opened and played once.
Pictures available on request. Buyer pays shipping.

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Rebirth
boardgame.description:
Black Rose Wars: Rebirth is a competitive fantasy game of deck-building, strategy, and combat set in the hectic universe of Nova Aetas in Italy. BRW:R is the second chapter in Black Rose Wars series. 25 years later, after the last war, mages are here in the Lodge, to re-establish order. Rooms are broken and now it's time to rebuild them up. Black Rose is still there.

Each player is one of powerful mages of the Black Rose Order who aspires to become the new Supreme Magister in order to acquire the mighty power of the Black Rose Artifact and the Forgotten Magic. Mages must fight, fulfill Black Rose desires, and gain strength with their spells until their power reaches the containment threshold of the prison where they are exiled, finally freeing themselves. Each mage has at their disposal six schools of magic, each one with its own strategy to annihilate their opponents and increase their power.

Mages fight each other in a modular arena of hexagons called "rooms". They summon powerful creatures, cast destructive spells, or devise dark deceptions with their enchantments. After being killed, mages are reborn immediately, allowing them to re-enter the fight without delay — although their death still fed energy to those mages who caused it.

The game system is divided into different phases. Each turn, after choosing new spells from the six schools of magic, players plan their strategy in advance, placing cards face down. Later, they reveal the played cards to kill each other, solve missions, summon creatures, or destroy the prison rooms, one against each other and against the Black Rose (the playing system).

Black Rose Wars: Armageddon Promo Card
Black Rose Wars: Black Lymph Promo Card
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Black Rose Wars: Carved Wooden Bowls
Black Rose Wars: e-Raptor UV Print Card holder
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Black Rose Wars: Ordeal Promo Cards
Black Rose Wars: Promo Forgotten Evocation
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Black Rose Wars: Rebirth - e-Raptor UV Print Insert
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Black Rose Wars: Supreme Invocation Promo Card

Include core game, Jukas Expansion, Irene the Wanderer, Deadly Masks 5th-6th Player Expanion, Apocalypse Expansion, Gaea Reborn Expansion, Dread Forge Expansion, all unlocked stretch goals. New KS Rebirth Core Box, Rotas box, KSE Jukas, Apocalypse, Dread Forge, Gaea Reborn, Deadly Masks, KSE Irene the Wanderer Expansion, plus Seal of Fire addon!
Final sale. Ships direct from publisher if ordered in time.

boardgame.name: Titanium Hearts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Titanium Hearts ​is about being a Robot who is growing more human than many of the actual humans in your world. In Titanium Hearts it is a Robot’s struggle to reconcile the seemingly immutable Laws that guide your every action with your innate desire to make yourself more than what you were programmed to be.

User summary:

The DOC version consists of two files (29-page game, 1-page character sheet) - these are combined in the 30-page PDF version.

boardgame.name: ΜΕΓΑΣ ΑΛΕΞΑΝΔΡΟΣ
boardgame.description:
Simple „Roll dice and Move“ game, similar to the „Game of Goose“.
Here players follow the path of campaign of Alexander the Great from Pella (in Macedon) through Asia Minor, the Levante, Egypt, Babylon, India (Hydapses) and Gedrosia to the Finish in Susa (Persia).

For the time the quality of content was great including plastic dice cups and Ancient looking - in fact Roman (!) - miniatures from famous firm Elastolin.

Gameplay is simple: Roll the dice and move along a given path. Certain spaces have „Events“ where things happen to you.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

boardgame.name: Crowsworn
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Explore a grim fantasy world inhabited by men and monsters alike in this action packed Metroidvania inspired by Hollow Knight, Bloodborne, and Devil May Cry!Crowsworn is a hand-drawn Metroidvania with a strong design emphasis on explorative platforming, immersive combat, and compelling storytelling.


Exceptional care has been taken to hand craft every single art asset as well as animate


every single frame in a beautiful traditional animation style.

EXPLORE A RUINED WORLD

In a dark and oppressive world, where even the air seems to carry weight, you awake from a deep slumber. Seemingly void of purpose, you venture forth attempting to retrace your steps and regain your lost memories...

In Crowsworn you will explore a giant interconnected world that is inhabited by vicious
enemies and monsters. And danger lurks around every corner.

GAMEPLAY

You will use a wide array of abilities to overcome platforming challenges while simultaneously juggling combat encounters. Every challenge is designed with the intent of having the player feel like a total bad ass when they triumphantly overcome it!

As you explore the nonlinear world, you will discover new
abilities that will allow you to backtrack and unlock new regions of the world to explore. As you explore you will encounter bosses. They will be challenging and they will be epic!

In Crowsworn you are equipped with three unique weapons that you will use to defeat enemies as you traverse the world.

These weapons are the Scythe, Pistols, and Corvian Magic.

Taking inspiration from Bloodborne and Devil May Cry led to the design of a highly stylized and fast paced combat system. We have gone to great lengths and spent countless hours iterating on the control feel and responsiveness in order to ensure that the game feels great to play.

Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Seeds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In His Majesty the Worm, characters adventure through a mythic underworld underneath the city at the center of the Wide World.

In the same way that a hobbit hole is different from a nasty, dirty, wet hole, the mythic underworld is different from a simple dungeon. It’s not merely a cave system with kobolds and goblins hiding in every shadowy corner. It’s another world, charged with unconventional physics, inhuman entities, and alien architectures.

As a gamemaster, creating a mythic underworld can seem daunting, but it’s really just a series of small, discrete tasks.

Break a megadungeon down to its atomic constituent parts.
Populate it with interesting things.
Connect these levels together.
It’s less making one huge megadungeon and more creating several, smaller dungeons and creating an appropriate flow between them.

This book contains a procedure for laying out interconnected dungeons, as well as inspirational dungeon seeds to use as prompts. Because His Majesty the Worm is not a premade setting, the descriptions of the seeds are just suggestions—meant to be evocative. For each seed, we’ve included a map from Dyson Logos. You can use this map or make one of your own using the procedures in this book.

By following through the atomized steps, you’ll have a working mythic underworld with a few hours of work.

This book contains:

A procedure for laying out a Jayquayed megadungeon layout
Twenty-one inspirational dungeon ideas with maps
Dungeon checklist that encourages meaningful exploration
Procedures for making maps, keying rooms, and making random encounter tables
Thorough walkthrough of making a dungeon level

boardgame.name: Legendary Monks II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Martial Arts!

Legendary Monks II is the latest volume of our series of class-focused player supplements, this volume is centered on the wise and capable masters of combat and mysticism; those paragons of insight known as monks. This new version of the base class introduced in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook was designed to be an agile combatant specialized in unarmed fighting, honing their body into a force that could rival weapons and armor forged by the most capable of smiths. This book is intended to build upon that promise, as well as expand the class with flavorful and potent character-building options that fully explore the many paths to perfection. This legendary monk class is intended to allow the monk to further specialize their combat through several new and redesigned class features such as Path of Mastery, which provides a strong foundation for a monk’s journey, whether based on strength, agility, or mysticism, Monk Arts which grant them several means of using their new Qi resource, and Combo Strikes which reward legendary monks for taking full advantage of their rapid-fire style of fighting. Furthermore, brand new archetypes provide further opportunities to construct unique characters, such as the black powder-fueled Combustion Knuckle and their special firearm-based combat, the gregarious Champion of the People who supports and inspires their comrades-in-arms, and the fierce Yaksha Disciple who channels the dread-inducing abilities of terrifying guardian spirits.

boardgame.name: Wizard Arcane Tradition: School of Chronomancy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Those who study the arcane have always found their spells to be most effective in manipulating the present. However, the existence of divination spells demonstrates that the future and past can also be affected by magic, and Chronomancers extend their arcane discipline to manipulate time to their advantage.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a wizard character, the School of Chronomancy gives you options to build a chronomancer, manipulating the flow of time around them to produce potent aftereffects on the spells they cast.

boardgame.name: Astro Colony
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Astro Colony is a first-person open-world sci-fi game focused on construction, automation and management of your space stations. Explore endless Universe and create the most efficient constellation of colonies. Build conveyor systems to automate production. Take care of Astronauts and their needs! Establish new colonies as part of intergalactic simulation.

Explore

Explore an endless Universe made out of fully destructible voxels.

Automate

Construct unique transport systems using conveyor belts and pipes.

Needs

Recruit new Astronauts and fulfill their needs by providing food and shelter.

Technologies

Research over 70 unique technologies to progress in colony development.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Volume 1 (Mörk Borg)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 new monsters for your Mork Borg games.
Every monster has extensive fluff including Description, Tactics, Lore, Ecology plus Adventure and Loot ideas.
Each download also contains Paper Mini Designs and VTT Tokens of the monster.

boardgame.name: Heroic Armory: Supply Drop III
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop Vol. III
Legacy of the Airlord
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some new equipment and items for your would-be vigilante? This book introduces a mix of new weapons and equipment useful for any self-respecting crime-fighter or half-decent detective.

Each volume in this new series details a small bit of backstory behind one of Aedrenar's greatest heroes (or villians), and provides some information about some of the gear they carried with them at different times. The best thing, is these heroes have long since had their time (or are prone to lending gear out to fellow heroes), so it can be used in creating your own!

Heroic Armory is a sourcebook for the Aedrenar Campaign Setting, which details new rules for outfitting powerful heroes. It includes a new 'Iconic Artifact' system, as well as numerous new magical devices that are useful to any character!

boardgame.name: Druid Circle: Circle of Civilization
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"There are those industrious souls who believe they can conquer nature. That by virtue of shaping stone and felling wood they have somehow removed themselves from the natural order. How very naive they are.”
- Everis SarKhal, Druid of Farkrist

Druids of the Circle of Civilization strive toward creating a balance between the cities of the continent and the natural world that surrounds them. Like their cousins, the silent guardians of the woods, these druids move throughout their chosen cities cultivating greenery, healing sickness before it can spread, protecting those who seek their stewardship, and tracking down those unnatural and unsavory things that would disrupt the harmony between the earthen realms and civilization that they seek to preserve.

This supplement includes:

The Circle of Civilization druid archetype.
2 new druid-specific spells.

boardgame.name: Bamberg
boardgame.description:
Bamberg is a social deduction game based on the witch trials of 17th century Europe.

At the beginning of the game, you will receive a secret role which can be Child, Villager, Witch or Familiar.

Children and Villagers belong to The Town team, whereas Witches and Familiars belong to The Coven team.

At first, you will not know who is on your team and who is against you, but as the game progresses, the event cards will help you discover more about each player’s identity.

At the end of each round, players will vote anonymously for whom to burn at the stake, and the player that receives most votes dies. Only Children and Witches reveal their role when they die.

If all Witches die, The Town wins the game. If all Children die, The Coven wins the game.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: The Perspective (Volume 7, Issue 1 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome Folks, just some updates going on around Soujourner Games and publication times. The Perspectve Volume 7; Issue 1

boardgame.name: Aninas Family Crypt (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The black swan’s disapproving glare bores into the top of your skull as you place the chisel against the crypt’s seal. Perched atop the moss-covered roof of the mausoleum, the rampant effigy stands stark and black against the scarlet backdrop of the setting sun whose fading red rays spur your hammer to strike. Sparks fly as steel meets steel, and a shrill death knell rings out across the lonely cemetery, startling the vast colonies of bats nesting in the dilapidated vaults. Like columns of dark smoke, they rise from a thousand charnel chimneys. Steeling yourself, you strike another blow, much harder and louder than the first. As the seal shatters, the fluttering black cloud blots out the fading sun, and you begin clawing frantically at the thick strands of ivy blocking the entrance. Overhead, the shrieking dark continues to gather. Throwing your weight against the groaning stones again and again, you force the doors to yield. A sibilant sigh, laden with the dust of ages, issues from the gaping entrance to the mausoleum, beckoning you into the benighted bower of the Aninas Family Crypt.

This Dungeon Backdrop is part of the Sacred Blood Storyline.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Ashlar campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: Aninas Family Crypt (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The black swan’s disapproving glare bores into the top of your skull as you place the chisel against the crypt’s seal. Perched atop the moss-covered roof of the mausoleum, the rampant effigy stands stark and black against the scarlet backdrop of the setting sun whose fading red rays spur your hammer to strike. boardgame.name: That Which Is Hidden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes are hired to conduct medical scans on a backwater planet. But what promises to be an easy mission with quick money becomes anything but as the heroes find themselves pawns in a shadowy game played by someone else’s rules. Can they realize the growing danger and deal with it? Or will they become casualties of plans made long ago and waiting to come to deadly fruition?

That Which is Hidden is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Cloudscape
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE

boardgame.name: Thaumaturgic Codex: Book III (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturgic Codex: Book III presents 20 unique spells for use with the 5e d20 RPG system.

Some of these spells first appeared in our other OGL titles, dating back to 2003, but have been gathered here and revised, improved, and updated to the new system. Others are new and were created for this edition. A few have been gathered from our other 5e titles. Included in this collection are spells up to 9th level such as:

Abyssal Vortex: Targets make three saving throws against the negative energy, acid, and mind bending power of this 9th level spell.

Diaphanous Shift: Become ghostly and transparent, gaining resistance to weapon damage with this 3rd level spell.

Labyrinthine Conundrum: Preoccupy your enemies with a contagious, unsolvable riddle!

Salty Wounds: Inflict debilitating pain upon your injured foes!

Soul Power: Bolster yourself or your allies! Gain protection from necrotic damage and bonuses on your d20 rolls!

Terra Form: Become a giant, stone creature, infused with the power of the earth!

When the north winds blow,

If Midsummer’s weather’s numbing,
Then know that Fimbulwinter’s coming.

Christmas in July is a self-contained adventure, set at the height of summer. As well as containing material that can be adapted for more conventional games of the ’TWAS RPG, this book also introduces new monsters to the game, and four new Player Characters.

boardgame.name: Lucid
boardgame.description:
Lucid is a game of risk, anticipation, drafting, and resource management. Each player takes the role of a dream-diver trying to study the consciousness of their subject, while also acting as a subject trying to mislead and evade their diver.

Players draft and build 12 card decks from a pool of 97 unique cards. These are Dream cards that they will be trying to hide from their diver, Dive cards that will define their methods of interpreting their subject's cards, and Lucid cards which will shape their overall strategy.

Each player plays as a Diver, trying to find their Subject’s valuable cards, and a Subject, trying to hide their valuable cards from a Diver.

Lucid is meant to give all the fun and stimulation of a drafting + deck-builder, in far less time, and with all the sneaky clever moments of a bluffing game.

Quick Rules Overview:

Lucid has 3 card types. Every 12-card deck contains 4 cards of each type.
Dreams - These are the cards you try to hide from your diver.
Dives - These are the cards you use to interpret your opponent’s cards, generally searching for dreams.
Lucids - These cards give you a specific bonus while active, and can be resolved for a larger bonus when replaced by another lucid.

Every round each player will:

Draw 3 cards

Prepare 3 cards:
Place 3 cards in front of you face-down, in 3 positions. Outer, Middle, and Inner.

Interpret one of their subject’s cards:
Your subject is the player to your left. You interpret one of their cards by flipping it face-up. You can do this by choosing any one of their 3 prepared cards, or by flipping up and following the instructions of a Dive card that you have prepared. Interpreting a card gives you resources and buries the card, disrupting your subject’s plans.
When you interpret a card, you will receive a bonus based on which position it was in.

Swap Lucids:
If you prepared a Lucid and your Diver did not find it, you can resolve your current active Lucid and replace it with the new one you prepared. You can also resolve your active Lucid and not replace it.

Have a Dream:
If you prepared a Dream and your Diver did not find it, you can reveal the Dream and do its effect.

Clean up:
Bury all prepared cards that are still face down and pass the first player token. If a player has 30 Insight, the game ends and the player with the most insight wins.

(View the full rulebook on the Lucid Website)

boardgame.name: The Heist of the Mad King's Jewel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heist of the Mad King’s Jewel is a novel take on the tabletop RPG formula. It is compatible with the D&D 5E system and places its ideas in an overcrowded steampunk city brimming with class, ethnic and interpersonal tensions. Big ideas, strong personalities, and rival interests clash daily in Moscopolis, the Jewel of the Far North, seeking to establish dominance over the city. The players are thrust into this environment and tasked to rob a bank. There is only one catch; It's one of the most secure places conceived by man or gnome alike. The players will be spicing up the already boiling cauldron that is Moscopolis, with their own brand of chaos. We wish you the best of luck adventurers and may fortune be ever in your favor!

A unique story in a rarely seen genre – a steampunk heist campaign, with a heavy focus on stealth, preparations, and intel gathering
A plethora of sidequests – should you seek respite from the main plot, or just some advantage for your plan, we’ve got you covered; from various odd jobs for the city’s numerous factions to murder mysteries, to matchmaking, there is something for everyone
New exciting subclasses - apart from providing suggestions as to how to adapt the flavor of some of the existing classes, we will be including 2 new subclasses (Saboteur and College of Diplomacy) for the rogue and bard
New magic and non-magic items - more than a dozen new magic and non-magic items await in the city of Moscopolis
New feats and backgrounds - add an extra touch of steampunk flair to your characters with feats and backgrounds written specifically for the adventure's backdrop
Large and complex final dungeon – the adventure culminates in the bank robbery, supporting multiple play-styles, from slipping in and out without ever being seen to running in guns blazing and slaughtering everyone in your path
A grand escape – the heist is not the end, however; you still have to deliver the goods and skip town, with possibly hundreds of police officers on your tail
Form a group of specialists – everyone in your party should, ideally, be part of a well-oiled machine; be aware of everyone’s strengths and weaknesses, and plan accordingly
Planning, planning, planning – we suggest you prepare well before attempting the heist; gather information, bribe officials, find allies… or not; there’s nothing stopping you from assaulting the bank straight from the port, just don’t say we didn’t warn you if things go south
Many NPCs – numerous factions with their own agendas thrive in Moscopolis, and it is up to you to choose friends and foes
Political intrigue – Moscopolitan society is a web of conflicting interests and intrigue, which you will have to navigate if you want to make the job go smoothly
A living and breathing city – Moscopolis is full of surprises, good, bad, and terrible; there are new possibilities waiting around every corner
Incredible artwork – professionally done art, by our illustrators
Setting open for expansion – if you want to add something during your run of the campaign, go straight ahead; you have our blessing
Beware of plague and disease – the hygiene in the city’s lower levels is, to put it mildly, not the best; dysentery, bubonic plague, leprosy, venereal diseases are all on the table, and catching them may further complicate your adventure
Additional activities and minigames – if you so desire, you can indulge in various side activities, such as dice games, betting on or participating in organized brawls in the grimy depths of the Pit; the bank won’t escape anywhere within an evening

boardgame.name: The World of the Amazing Universe: Energy Defensive Generating Exosuit and Infinity Metal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many people think that the Energy Defensive Generating Exosuit is a form of technology. That, on swallowing one of the small, aspirin-shaped, tablets, a special form of miraculous machinery is generated in the form of mechanical armor. However, the “tiny robots” are only one portion of the Energy Defensive Generating Exosuit. On taking a Exosuit Tablet, a special series of chemicals bonds temporarily with the cells of the wielder. As the nano-machines activate and form into the external exoskeletal armor, the chemical bond gives the wielder mental control over them and their final shape as if it were part of their body – largely because, until their charge is depleted and the chemical unbinds, it is essentially a grafted-on, prosthetic, organ. On unbinding, the machines become an inert, dust-like, substance and the chemicals are disposed of by the body’s waste-processing system.

Infinity Metal is a hyper-conductive metal found sparsely across the Earth in small but valuable deposits. Amongst the unusual properties of Infinity Metal, the most notable is the ability to negate and wrap gravity. Objects made of Infinity Metal are thus lighter than they appear and if specially crafted can allow their wielder to alleviate and in some cases, fly. While the negation of gravity is the most notable use of Infinity Metal, however, the material’s gravity manipulating properties can even enhance the physical strength and physique of those who use or possess it. Infinity Metal can, by reducing the stress of pressure on the body, also provide swift healing to wounds or act as a conduit for various esoteric energies. Infinity Metal can also help a body manipulate its own temperature, generating heat in cold environments and keeping the wearer cool in hot ones. Perhaps one of the strangest properties of Infinity Metal comes due to its manipulation of gravity. The metal is so unique disruptive to the electromagnetic spectrum, that people have claimed that they have seen spirits and ghosts while in possession of this material, but never truly confirmed.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about World of the Amazing Universe: Energy Defensive Generating Exosuit (E.G.D.E.) and Infinity Metal in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.

boardgame.name: Castle Sunspire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sign of a peaceful and prosperous kingdom, Castle Sunspire is a glorious palace

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Castle Sunspire is huge, highly-detailed palatial castle. Ideal as a chateau, fairy tale castle, palace or fine mansion.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of a multiple level storey castle, spread across 7 50x50 battlemaps, each depicting a different floor of the building.
Cellar - stores, treasure vaults, tombs, catacombs and crystal caverns
Ground floor - exterior formal garden, lakeside, stables, throne room etc
1st Floor - bedrooms, galleries, secret rooms
2nd Floor - library, servant rooms, meeting rooms
3rd Floor - attic, tower levels, roof access
4th floor - study, astrologers tower
Rooftop

boardgame.name: When You Can't Fight What You Can't See
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your comrades are falling ill and no one knows why. Soon there won’t be enough healthy soldiers to hold the line. You have to go find help... while you still can.

The 2020 global pandemic delayed production of the Campaign Dossiers, along with much else. It naturally put us in mind of the 1918 flu and how it impacted the First World War. We commissioned this adventure, set during the first days of the flu, as a thank you to our backers for waiting for us to wrap up production. We now offer it to everyone for free, and we hope you find some enjoyment in it.

boardgame.name: The Sight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dense and trackless forest, the shadowy stretches of rambling roads, the ruins of sacked churches—the otherworldly slithered through widening gaps in the weave of our world. Once folklore served as a tool of education and warning; now, it became something visceral and dangerous.

The return of the supernatural brought with it primaeval power that might reshape the world. Yet, while some Agents of the Dee Sanction call upon the Angelic powers to guide and protect them, others use the uncommon visions and counsel of the supernatural—the Sight.

The Dee Sanction is a tabletop role-playing game about serving Queen and country in the late Tudor period. While kingdoms vie for power and the Church splinters under the pressure of reform, folklorish creatures emerge from enforced hiding seeking revenge against those who imprisoned them.

The Sight is a 16-page PDF that expands on the options available in character generation for both Agents and antagonists alike. It introduces talents of Aura Reading, Scrying, Prophecy and Token Reading, with guidance on visions, communing with spirits, possession, hypnosis, and the miraculous intervention of the Divine Chorus.

boardgame.description:
PureArts and Ubisoft present the officially licensed Orlog Dice Game of Assassin’s Creed Valhalla! Played extensively by the Norsemen and Anglo-Saxons in every city of the video game, Orlog is played by two players who use dice rolls and bonus effects to claim victory over their opponent.

Players roll dice to generate attacks and acquire tokens for God favors - using a combination of both during attacks and for regaining health. Players cast their dice 3 times a round until resolution. Play continues until one player has lost all Health stones.

Will you earn the favor of the Gods and receive their blessings to win? There’s only one way to find out.

boardgame.name: Escape the Hyperion
boardgame.description:
Play as the last remaining survivors attempting to escape a deadly alien infestation on the Hyperion, a futuristic advanced modular colony built on Planet X. You must navigate through the colony to find and modify the coordinates of the Teleport Pad to escape. All of the remaining survivors must escape before the teleport pads are removed from the game.

The game is divided into 3 simple phases. The first phase is the action phase. During this phase, you must do two of the following:

1- Reveal: this is when you reveal tiles based on the number of doors your current room contains.
2- Move: Move your survivor to an orthogonally adjacent tile.
3- Unlock: unlock any temporarily locked tiles.
4- Rest: discard 1 tile to rest. You will not have the chance to do a second action.

The second phase is the enemy movement phase. Move the stalkers 1 space (orthogonally) towards the nearest player.

The third phase is the lockdown phase. Discard any temporarily locked tiles from the game board.

The game ends when:
A- All the survivors escape together
B- You discard all of the Console tiles without modifying all of the coordinates
C- You discard all of the Teleport Pad tiles.
D- You run out of tiles to place.

boardgame.description:
With the Expansion New Markets players can generate a completely new distribution of merchandise. Instead of using the merchandise printed on the map players will now place the merchandise token by random principle over the map. We included a couple of options. For example a completely open distribution and the option of placing the merchandise face down. So, players know they have to have a trading post with silver to be allowed to develop the banking system. But you need to first find silver before you can create a trading post.
There will be an optional rule that heavily favors the powers who have well developed their fleet. So, players quickly need to find and explore wood and wool to develop their fleet.

This expansion brings a lot of variety and fun to the three games of the series. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: History of the Ancient Seas: Expansion II – Barbarians & Pirates
boardgame.description:
“Sail in sight!” calls the sentry on the tower. To whom do these sails at the horizon belong? A homecoming merchant ship that has a fully loaded hold of gold or salt? An enemy ship with a diplomat on board to negotiate peace? Or are these the black sails of the feared pirates that don’t negotiate but come to plunder and burn down harbors and warehouses?
With the expansion Barbarians and Pirates players can add a new party to the game that will challenge the players for sure.
The playing pieces of the barbarians and pirates are brought into play by the players and will then be played by AI. Players place them but can’t control them. So, a player needs to be careful what he wishes for. To call for the barbarians and pirates at first might seem like a call for help to threaten your opponents but they can turn their attention quickly towards you.

If not opposed right away the hordes of barbarians and pirate fleets can become a real threat to your empire.

This expansion brings a lot of variety and fun to the three games of the series. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bible Brawl
boardgame.description:
The Bible is filled with a lot of crazy stories that our old Sunday School teachers felt they couldn't teach to a group of kids.

Bible Brawl is a "Take-that" style card game that includes some of the most iconic characters and stories you never heard of.

In Bible Brawl, you create a battleline made up of Judges, Prophets, Warriors, Giants, Kings, and Beasts and where you battle with your opponents in order to gain the most honor. The first player to reach 20 honor, wins.

On a player's turn they use Action Points to purchase Action Cards, Recruit Characters from a lineup, or use them to attack another character on the battlefield. The game ends after the winning player gains 20 honor from the defeated characters.

boardgame.name: A game about WEE WHIMSICAL CREATURES and trying to identify them after someone makes noises.
boardgame.description:
80 wonderfully weird beasties that ask you to ponder, "What noises would these creatures makes?"

One person randomly picks a target creature, ponders what noise it might make, then makes that noise, trying to keep it distinct from the other 4 monsters that are visible on the table.

The noise-maker gets a point if the majority of players guess correctly. Guessers get a point if guessing correctly OR if guessing with the majority.

This is the first 'Bezzy Budget Bag' game. It was sold in a resealable plastic bag for £5 GBP at UKGE 2021 (selling out after a day). A reprint will come by the end of 2021.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Master Hunter
boardgame.description:
Face your own friends in a merciless battle to decide who will be the next Master Hunter, creatures and traps await you in this quick card game where only one can survive!

Each player will have their own character cards that they must keep alive. On each turn, the player decides which threat card on the board to explore, he will use the dice to overcome the creatures or traps he finds. All players will compete for the same goal: to survive and become a master hunter. During the game, everyone will be able to hinder the hunt of others by means of cards from the deck. The player who survives the threats and his friends will be the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rat Queens: Braga Expansion
boardgame.description:

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dance of Pales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Dance of Pales, a group of level-4 adventurers learns about the murder of Countess Diana Namallo on her wedding day by her husband-to-be, Lord Carlsven, a man who was supposed to bring peace between two realms. The man used the celebration as a means to inebriate his opponent's army and strike hard when no one had a chance of survival.

More than a hundred years later, a descendant of the Carlsven feels a calling to the cemetery where the Namallo mausoleum rests. Many of the dead have risen, empowered by Diana Namallo's desire for revenge. The city watch doesn't know what to do with the living dead, who are certainly frightening everyone.

boardgame.name: Thaemin's Guide to Gods and Miracles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thaemin’s Guide to Gods and Miracles is the ultimate guide to the divine in D&D, whether as a faithful acolyte of the gods or figuring out how to actually use gods in your campaign. Learn the secrets that only spirits know and summon powerful outsiders to fight beside you with the new Summoner class, or transform from aasimar, Divine Soul, or similarly divinely aligned being into a full-on celestial yourself with the new angel transformation, giving you a radiant aura, resilience against radiant and lightning damage, flight, and the ability to tell instantly when a creature is lying to you.

As a GM, you’ve probably found that making players care about even one god is difficult, and that getting them to care about an entire pantheon is a fool’s errand unless you’re importing something they already know, probably Greek or Norse mythology. But we’re not ancient Greeks, so why does Greek mythology stick to our brains so much better than fantasy pantheons do? The secret lies in the stories and character relationships that bind these ancient pantheons together, and Thaemin’s Guide to Gods and Outsiders is packed with advice on how to make a pantheon your players will actually care about, whether that’s presenting an existing pantheon in a more interesting way than just listing them all in alphabetical order, or creating your very own pantheon from scratch.

As a player, have you ever found yourself playing a Cleric, a Paladin, or any sort of character with the Acolyte background, and your religion just doesn’t come up at all? You might say “by the power of Crystal Dragon Jesus!” before casting a spell, and you might say that you’re setting out on this quest because Crystal Dragon Jesus commands it, but if you didn’t say that and just set out on the quest because you personally believe it’s the right thing to do, it wouldn’t really make any difference, would it? At best, you might mention that your character is attending religious services as regularly as they’re able, but that’s something they do alone, which is therefore very quickly glossed over. Thaemin’s Guide tells you how to incorporate religious ritual into actual play with prayers you can use in game to reinforce your character’s faith through actual roleplay. When your ship is sinking, you pray to the god of the sea to get you out of this alive, and that’s a character moment, something they wouldn’t do if they weren’t religious that’s directly relevant to the plot, rather than a brief mention that you are ignoring the plot to go do something else for two hours.

And if you’ve ever wanted the celestial stat blocks to actually be used for anything, Thaemin’s Guide has dark angels, including not only new stat blocks for a variety of new celestials, but also the promotion of evil gods to their proper place as gods, served by their very own angels of fire, pestilence, and darkness, never again to feed on whatever fiendish leftovers Hell and the Abyss leave for them, nor to be represented by a single citadel or library on a plane ruled over by an archdevil. The evil gods are gods, their servants are angels, and when the god of fire sends one of their servants to burn down something you’d prefer remained intact, you are going to fight a deva.

boardgame.name: Iskandar City Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore a wondrous new city in this sourcebook for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Iskandar! City of the Shining Spires! Where merchants are masters and coin is king, but thieves and assassins rule the night. Where gods and priests walk side by side even as unspeakable wealth peers down upon crushing poverty. Where guilds and great houses spar for political supremacy while fiendish hordes muster just over the horizon. Iskandar! Home to all that is wondrous, noble, and laudable, and to all that is lewd, wanton, and vile.

Iskandar City Sourcebook offers an in-depth description of this superb new fantasy city. Alongside the setting lore, this guide is packed with content that can be used in any Fifth Edition game, including:

3 new races (Kith, Vargr, Vatborn)
3 new subclasses (Night Domain, Bladedancer, Cinderwood Knight)
A uniquely detailed NPC generator
100 city-based encounters
19 detailed city locations
18 character vignettes
17 adventure seeds
Random tables to create taverns, ships, religious festivals, academies, guilds, and much more!
Welcome to Iskandar, the greatest city in the world!

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black V: Imperial Book of Common Prayer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Galaxy Black V The Imperial Book of Common Prayer

When Is the Future?

The Might of the Holy Hexad of the Empress Imperium

Crusade for Starfire

Invoke the Empress

Get caught up in the affairs of the Old Gods

The endless manipulations of the Angels of Man

Fight the return of the Lords of Ignorance.

Godmakers

Create your own gods your own pantheon

Chose which among them to fall with the demonmaker

Create a cult around them to aid or oppose the Holy Mother Imperial Church.

Call on the Gods and Take The Stars for your faith

The human race is gone but humanity lives on, it’s culture and genome infecting a million worlds.

Nothing is ever forgotten Even in a Collapsing Universe; the struggle of Law and Chaos goes on.
What is Galaxy Black?

Galaxy black is a science fiction and space fantasy toolkit for your DCC RPG game. A lightly gothic semi-humorous fantasy of the space future that was, and could still be, one day. With magic, bright colours, and deep implications. For everyone.

With Galaxy Black you should be able to fake your way through your favorite SF

franchise without any problems at all – from golden age space opera to grotty modern post-cyberpunk, from the gutter to the stars, and all points in between.

Galaxy black is also, for those who want it, a setting, showing one example of how using all the elements in the book (and there are a lot of them!) together can work, using a traditional golden age Galactic Empire as a model.

Galaxy black is generators! Make worlds, cultures, aliens, gods, and technology, use the campaign frameworks and adventure generators to inspire or map out a whole adventure, a whole campaign!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Paleo: A New Beginning
Paleo: Een nieuwe start
Paleo: Ein neuer Anfang
Paleo: Un nuevo comienzo
Paléo: Une nouvelle ère
boardgame.description:
New adventures await in Paleo: Ein neuer Anfang!

A year has passed since the release of Paleo, but in the world of the game several thousand years have passed. We've tried to settle, but nothing is as peaceful as it might seem. New dangers and tasks await us, but with a little skill and new tools we can manage to settle down.
