boardgame.name: Walking Baby
boardgame.description:
What a joy a baby is! All that fun, laughter and the first steps. Toddlers come and go, pack and frolic, so they need a lot of attention. But who will do the housework, put the baby to sleep for the night and who will change the baby?

Walking Baby is a cooperative board game. The game is set in an eco household, so nappies are changed using colourful washable nappies. You have a long weekend to keep the rooms tidy while also keeping your baby happy. Every day is another challenge, because your baby always wants something different.

In Walking Baby each player controls a family member: mom, dad, grandma or grandpa. There are 8 rooms of the house where they can move around. And of course, there is the baby who always wants something and makes a lot of mess around the house. The game lasts for 3 days, that's 12 rounds (shifts of the day). In each round new housework tasks appear and the baby has new wishes to be fulfilled to keep up his/her mood.

Players win if they last until the evening of the 3rd day. But they will lose if the baby starts to cry or the housework overflows.

Players roll 2 dice simultaneously (starting player also rolls the baby dice). The throw shows the number of action points that can be used to move a character between rooms, perform housework tasks, change nappy, fulfil needs of baby cards or cheer up the baby. Plan your actions because you'll get more tired as evening approaches. Time for a coffee! Use it wisely to gain energy for the night shift.

Can you cope with even the most chaotic situation? Work together and hold on for three days to win! Your reward is a weekend spa! ;)

There are two game modes to play in Walking Baby: FAMILY and FROLIC mode.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Malebranche
boardgame.description:
Malebranche is a small abstract strategy game inspired by Mitsuo Yamamoto's King's Valley, with the addition of special powers on the pieces. It's published in XVgames's bagstract format.

In this small portable game with the board printed on the bag, players randomize with dice a set of 4 pieces plus a damned soul. The pieces have different powers. Players will need to move them in straight lines to try to make blocks and paths so that the damned soul can move into the central space of the board, the Hell's pit. The player who can do so first wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Suez Canal Girl
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User summary

Puzzle games inspired by the Suez Canal incident of 2021 where a container ship got stuck in the Canal. It contains nudity of anime "container ship girls".

boardgame.name: Shogun Tactics
boardgame.description:
Shogun Tactics is a strategy game that includes ninjas. The core goal for each player is to eliminate the pawns of the other player or grab the treasure. Each ninja has different abilities and should play strategically to win the game.The game can be played by two or four players.

The armies are placed on the tableau opposing each other.
Behind each army their own treasure is protected.
Each unit has its own way of movement and attack.
Units unlike Chess do not occupy the space of the fallen enemy, but stay in the space that they attacked. All but one unit, move horizontally and vertically only. ​

Each army is consisted by 7 different units:

7x Ashigaru - The most basic unit which moves 1 space horizontally or vertically. It can attack in one direction.
2x Double Edge - This unit can move 3 spaces and attack simultaneously on its front, left and right.
2x Monkey - This unit can move 3 spaces in any direction they like and then attack an enemy in left, right, front or back direction.
1x Cannon - This unit can move 1 space in any direction. This unit attacks the 3 spaces in a line. On attack this unit fires a cannon ball that hits all the targets, friendly or not.
1x Rope - This is the only unit that can move diagonally. It moves as many spaces it likes and attacks only diagonally one adjacent space.
1x King - This unit is the most liked. It can move 1 space in any direction but it can shoot its valistra and assassinate any enemy unit occupying a space up to 3 spaces in front of the King.
2x Wall - This unit is indestructible. It can move 1 space in any direction and also blocks all cannonballs and valistra arrows.


Once again, to win, a player should eliminate all enemy units or put a unit on the space occupied by the enemy treasure.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Soviet Front
boardgame.description:
"Soviet Front" is a 1-4 player wargame simulation of the 1941-45 war between the Axis and the Soviet Union which features unusual and unpredictable systems for combat, movement, reinforcements, resources and so on. The purpose of this is to create a 'fog of war' so that a player is not only uncertain of the enemy's actual strength and effectiveness but also his own as well. The time required to play the game varies from the quick single turn Blitzkrieg scenario to the lengthy 48 turn Great Patriotic War. The game consists of a rulebook, counters, map, playsheet, 6 six-sided dice (3 white, 2 blue and 1 red) and a box. 2 opaque cups are also required. The Axis forces are represented by German, SS and allied units (Italy, Romania, Hungary, Finland and other sympathisers) and the Soviet Union by Soviet and Guard units.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Postage to the UK is £5, to Europe is £10 and elsewhere is £15. Add £1.50 for optional parcel tracking. The map and counters are mounted but the latter are not die cut and require cutting. The game uses six 6-sided dice but these are not provided.

The map and counters are mounted but the latter are not die cut and require cutting. The game uses six 6-sided dice but these are not provided.
Posted out by First Class Royal mail by the game designer in the UK (so not from France). P&P is to be paid by the buyer. P&P to a UK address is £5 and is £10 to the European Union and £15 to the rest of the world.
Images are available via the BGG link for this game in the images section.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – e-Raptor Insert
boardgame.description:
e-Raptor Insert compatible with Cthulhu: Death May Die is your must have accessory designed to organize and improve the experience of the gameplay.

Thanks to our insert you can arrange all game components and sleeved cards to keep them in order – no more mess on the table while playing. No more looking for necessary elements during the game.

Moreover, when the box is closed, the components are still kept in order, ready for setting another game faster than ever!

The insert is durable and made of high-quality HDF. To assemble it, there is no glue required. It allows you to hold all components inside the box. You can see the suggested components setup on the pictures. This offer concerns only insert. The game is not included.

Box with insert can be stored sideways - parts of the insert have plexiglass lids that protect elements from falling out. Plexiglass lids have foils, should be taken off before assembling.

boardgame.name: Sonic: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Race through Sonic the Hedgehog video game inspired stages built by flipping through a deck of cards. But watch out for the bad guys or you could be eliminated from the race.

Players will push their luck by deciding prior to each card flip if they will stay in the race or retire. Retire and you'll collect all the rings and bonus cards revealed in the stage so far. Keep racing and potentially earn even more rings and bonuses, but risk losing a life when a second villain card is revealed.

Players will have two cards in hand, one to show that they will keep racing and one to say that they will retire. Each turn all players still in the race will secretly select a card, they'll place it face down on the table. Once all players have made a selection the next card in the deck is turned over and added to the "course" of cards on the table. If there are two of the same boss cards in the course when it's flipped, all remaining players lose a life token (of which they have three) and a new round begins. The game is played over five total rounds. When players choose to retire, they will collect all ring tokens on the course at the time and keep them for end game scoring.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Sonic the Hedgehog

boardgame.name: Chittering Mines: The Lost Laboratory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Face fungal horrors and uncover the secrets of the lost laboratory!

The Lost Laboratory is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 5th to 7th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 6. Characters who survive this adventure should earn enough experience to reach the 7th level.

Buried deep below the earth is an old duergar wizard’s complex. Once upon a time it hummed with activity as the duergar wizard Sorcha and her assistants researched and experimented with the creation of half-dragons. Now, it lies in ruin, consumed by a parasitic fungus. Its former occupants roam its festered halls in search of fresh bodies to infect.

boardgame.name: Snakes in a Bar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Survive a deadly bar brawl in this fast-paced adventure!

Snakes in a Bar is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 3rd to 4th level, and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. Characters who survive this adventure should earn half of the XP required to reach the 4th level. This adventure takes place in a bar. This adventure assumes placement in DMDave’s Blutstrom campaign setting. However, it can just as easily be placed in any campaign setting that has a city and demons.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Snake Queen
Snake Queen's Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Battle a marilith alongside her demonic and snake minions in this boss battle!

Lair of the Snake Queen is a Fifth Edition encounter for four characters of 4th, 10th, or 16th level. This encounter is setting and adventure independent. It can easily be inserted into any story that you like, or even run as a one-shot. The add-on includes rules for running the featured marilith independently or as part of a multi-wave battle.

boardgame.name: Dretches in a Garden
Dretches in the Garden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dretches in the Garden is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 1st to 2nd level, and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 1. Characters who survive this adventure should earn half of the XP required to reach the 2nd level. This adventure takes place in a recently abandoned botanical garden. This adventure assumes placement in the DMDave Worlds’ Blutstrom campaign setting. However, it can just as easily be placed in any campaign setting that has a moderately wealthy city or the ruins of one.

boardgame.name: Goblin Graves
Grave Goblins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Confront a group of goblins hiding out in an ancestral burial ground!

Grave Goblins is a 5th Edition adventure for three to seven characters with an average party level of 1 to 2.

In this adventure, the characters learn about a minor conflict between a group of goblins and a family of dwarves. The characters are tasked with removing the goblins from an ancestral burial site.

boardgame.name: Ruins of Kupe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rescue an archaeologist that’s been captured by tormented spirits of the dead!

Ruins of Kupe is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters, optimized for a party of five characters of 6th level. This adventure is part of DMDave’s Desert of Desolation adventure path.

In this adventure, the characters confront the shadowswords at the Ruins of Kupe and attempt to rescue Aronin, an archaeologist, or, failing that, his journal. Within the ruins, the characters will learn about the lost Silver Pyramid, a tomb believed to hold an ancient pharaoh’s wealth, and a crystal lens that will allow them to find the lost pyramid and four hidden temples, each holding a key needed to enter the pyramid.

boardgame.name: Mad Wizard's Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the quirky tower of a strange wizard!

The MAD Wizard’s Tower is a Fifth Edition adventure balanced for three to seven characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. Characters of higher level may find the combat encounters trivial, however the social elements of the tower should still offer an interesting experience.

boardgame.name: Hungry Hungry House: Enter the Mimic!
Hungry Hungry House: Into the Mimic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Escape the clutches of a house-sized mimic in this unusual side quest!

Hungry Hungry House: Enter the Mimic is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 3rd level and is optimized for five characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. The characters find themselves in the bowels of a living house. Can they make it out alive?

boardgame.name: Chittering Mines: Silence at Farnhurst Hollow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Investigate the mining operation at Farnhurst Hollow and discover the secret to an ecological crisis below!

Silence at Farnhurst Hollow is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters of 5th to 6th level, and is optimized for five players with an average party level (APL) of 5. Characters who survive this adventure should earn enough experience to reach the 6th level.

This adventure takes place in a mine adjacent to the sea. This adventure assumes placement in the DMDave Worlds’ Dark Sea campaign setting, specifically along the southeastern shore near Ash Hallow. However, it can just as easily be placed in any campaign setting that has a rocky, humid stretch near water. This adventure can be played as a one-shot or as part of the two-part series, Chittering Mines.

boardgame.name: Marauders of the Lost Tomb
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the centuries-old Tomb of Emun-Rah in this adventure for three to seven characters, optimized for a party of five characters of 3rd level.

An angelic cat has just informed you that marauders have begun to defile a nearby pyramid, and that it’s up to you to stop them. Will you heed the cat’s warning and refrain from disturbing the tomb yourself? Or will you plunder it for everything it’s worth? Avoid traps, explore secret passageways, and find wondrous loot in this epic desert adventure!

boardgame.name: Forgotten Temple of Ateus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forgotten Temple of Ateus is a Fifth Edition adventure for three to seven characters, optimized for a party of five characters of 9th level.

This adventure details the ruins of the forgotten temple of Ateus where one of the four pieces of the staff of Harkhem is hidden.

This adventure is part of DMDave’s Desert of Desolation adventure path. If you are running this adventure independently, consider switching out the piece of the staff of Harkhem for a different magical item or plot token.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #8 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon (https://www.patreon.com/LegendaryLoot) and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the mask of deadspeech, bloody boomerang, cloudstep boots, and staff of spell echoes!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like tamer's whip, aqueous extraction, tiger trap, and consuming fire!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new iguaca and wolákan races and half a dozen new feats like Eclectic Training and Lava Shaper!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the kyeryong, giant iguana, and the sinister underworld dragon!

boardgame.name: OpenQuest (3rd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

OpenQuest is an easy to play and straightforward fantasy roleplaying game that uses the tried and tested D100 dice mechanic.

OpenQuest lets you play fantastic death defying adventurers, in search of fame and fortune.

Every step of the way you’ll be supported by these easy to understand rules based upon over forty years of the tried and tested D100 mechanic.

Easy to Learn. The rules have been pared back to the bare minimum and most rules only need a single roll to determine success or failure.

Organised. Fourteen logical easy to follow chapters, with advice for both Players and Referees throughout.

Complete. This book contains all you need to play (except dice). Rules, loot, creatures, an example fantasy setting and an adventure are all provided.

Examples. As well as the adventures of Elthelred the Reckless there are numerous examples of play.

Time-Tested. This version of the rules is based upon the author’s in-game experiences of over thirty years.

Flexible. Easily adaptable to the Fantasy world of your choice.

Open. The rules in this book are Open Gaming Content so other publishers can easily use them for their own releases.

Fun. All this builds up to a game that is designed to be entertaining first.

boardgame.name: Serpentine Temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The local smith is distraught and can't fix your weapons right now. He explains that his daughter has been taken by some cultists and he fears for her safety. Upon discovering you are brave adventurers, he offers to fix your weapons if you can go rescue her at the local temple.

The scenario was designed for a quartet of second level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Straight from the Dragon's Mouth

Discover how dragons embody magic across the worlds of D&D and how you can bring them to life at your table in this quintessential reference guide for the world’s greatest roleplaying game.

Meet Fizban the Fabulous: doddering archmage, unlikely hero of the War of the Lance, divine avatar of a dragon-god—and your guide to the mysteries of dragonkind in the worlds of Dungeons & Dragons.

What is the difference between a red dragon and a gold dragon? What is dragonsight? How does the magic that suffuses dragons impact the world around them? Here is your comprehensive guide to dragons, filled with the tips and tools Dungeon Masters and players need for their encounters with these dangerous magical creatures.

Dragonslayers and dragon scholars alike will appreciate the new dragon-themed options for players eager to harness the power of dragon magic and create unique and memorable draconic characters. Dungeon Masters will discover a rich hoard of new tools and information for designing dragon-themed encounters, adventures, and campaigns. Discover a host of new dragons and other creatures. Learn about the lairs and hoards of each type of dragon, and how hoards focus the magic that suffuses dragons and connects them to the myriad worlds of the Material Plane. Discover everything there is to know about the most iconic monsters of D&D with help from Fizban, your expert advisor on dragonkind!


Introduces gem dragons to fifth edition!
Reveals the story of the First World and the role Bahamut and Tiamat played in its creation and destruction.
Adds new player character options, including unique draconic ancestries for dragonborn, dragon-themed subclasses for monks and rangers, and new feat and spell options.
Offers everything a Dungeon Master needs to craft adventures inspired by dragons across the worlds of D&D, with new dragon lair maps and details on 20 different kinds of dragons.
Presents a complete dragon bestiary and introduces a variety of new dragons and dragon-related creatures, including aspects of the dragon gods, dragon minions, and more.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Beadle & Grimm's Silver Edition of Fizban's Treasury of Dragons

boardgame.name: Henry's Feast
boardgame.description:
King Henry VIII’s trip to India cannot successfully conclude until he gets a taste of the best Indian food the King of India has to offer. The Indian King has commissioned some of the finest chefs to compete for a chance to cook at Henry’s Feast. He has asked his Head Chef to arrange the competition.

Henry's Feast is a competitive, family friendly, appetizing, cooking board game for the hungry. A balanced but deep strategy game where players are constantly challenged to think ahead and work with limited resources to cook King Henry's favorite dishes.

The game consists of a personal kitchen in the form of player board that each player will use to cook their dishes. The kitchen also has a pantry with a limited space and can only store so many ingredients. Players are forced to choose between using their stations to start cooking, and therefore, revealing the dishes they want to cook or store them in the pantry for future use. However, the empty space in the pantry will determine how many ingredients you can take in the next round. In the middle of all the players, lies the Stockroom that is quicker to get to, but has a lower probability of finding the ingredients you need. The Market has all the ingredients but is farther and requires more time (an extra round) to utilize.

The Recipes (50 of them) tell you all the ingredients you need to cook various types of dishes. They can be Easy, Medium or Hard to cook, and also lets you know the course of the dish. The recipes for the Feast create a race to the finish line and determines who ends the game first. But the Chef's Corner will provide you with those extra recipes that will let you get ahead of the competition and win it.

Not that fast! Winning doesn't come easy and the multitude of strategies come from the Chef's Bonus. Stations, Satchels, Hand Limit and Pantry all give you an extra edge throughout out the game. At higher bonus levels that edge becomes larger but getting the bonuses isn't an easy feat. You will have to choose between when to go for the victory points or when to get the bonuses. They all use the same resources, and maintaining that balance while controlling your heartbeat as someone visits Chef's Corner to steal the recipe you have been working so hard to cook is where Henry's Feast will test your limits.

On a players turn they will perform one action to take the available ingredients or steal recipes. Using these the player will Cook dishes which will earn them victory points or bonuses. Victory points may also be earned from making combos of dishes or making the most number of dishes.

The game ends when a player cooks all the feast recipes and announces Last Call. This sets up the last round. After the last round is done victory points are counted and the player with the most victory points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Namma Bengaluru
boardgame.description:
For many decades, Bangalore was the Garden City of India, but now it sports a different avatar. With the rise in IT companies all over the city, Bangalore became popular as the Silicon City of India, sometimes also referred to as the start-up capital of India. Ask a local about the Bangalore they remember, and you will be taken on a walk down memory lane of an era gone by: Sprawling green parks filled with trees, beautiful lakes, bustling markets and shopping centers contrast the buzzing business and industrial areas against the solace of cosy residential areas.

Namma Bengaluru — or "Our Bengaluru" as translated from the native language Kannada (which is pronounced "Kun" like in "gun" and "nada" like "na-da") — is a game inspired by the publisher's hometown of Bangalore, India.

In the game, you plan and build neighborhoods in the city of Bengaluru. To start, you have a hand of two tiles (with tiles coming in five types) and a neighborhood card that shows a way to score points. On a turn, you either play a tile into the city, matching tile types or roads to do so; swap the tiles in hand for two new ones; draw a neighborhood card; or remove a neighborhood card in hand to place a tile on top of an existing tile. When no tiles remain in the draw pile, each player takes a final turn, then reveals their neighborhood cards, scoring for each pattern of tiles in the city that matches what's shown on their card; some cards provide bonus points based on your ability to place tiles of the right type next to scoring patterns you have.

Whoever scores the most points wins, with ties being broken in favor of whoever holds fewer cards.

boardgame.name: CRASH/CART
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Crash Cart is a roleplaying game about a private ambulance crew operating in the pressure cooker environment of a near-future California Metropolitan Axis (henceforth referred to as the CalAxis.). You play working stiffs, who are not particularly cyber nor punk, trying to make it through their shift unscathed. It is an impossible job, as the beleaguered paramedics are caught between the hammer of their demanding corporate overlords and the tongs of desperately violent near-future streetlife..

Each game session spans a single shift, involving one or more ambulance runs from Crash Cart HQ (LLC, incorporated 2037, currently rated a solid, if unimpressive “B” on the Lunar Stock Index). The crew retrieves their client(s) (we used to call them patients) and then shuttles them to their chosen Medical Care Destination. Keep in mind that a healthy client is a happy, non-litigious client.

The average Crash Cart employee burns out within three weeks. You rounded that bend months ago. Something far more powerful than money or job security drives you. Finding out why ordinary people take extraordinary risks is what this game is about.

boardgame.name: Scrabble: Scorepad Wallet
boardgame.description: Box contains a wallet, 2 scorepads for Scrabble and one pencil

boardgame.name: One Man's Trash
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Here’s your treasure… good luck getting it home!

Treasure should be interesting — not just piles of coins! In The Hobbit, Tolkien mentions “countless piles of precious things” and “coats of mail, helms and axes, swords and spears hanging” among the treasures in Smaug’s hoard. Fritz Leiber’s Grey Mouser finds “slim books bound in gold-lined fine-grained red and violet leather”, “a rack of gleaming lenses and slim brass tubes”, and “a slim dark-haired girl [in] a gold-barred cage” in his “Bazaar of Bizarre”.
   Even Gary Gygax recommends against treasure simply being heaps of coin, asking “Is not a suit of armor of great value? What of a supply of oil?” and goes on to say that “the upper levels of a dungeon need not be stuffed like a piggy bank”.
   Unfortunately, the rules of old-school RPGs don’t give GMs much help in creating interesting and varied treasure hoards… which is where this book comes in! Inside, you’ll find tables to assist you in crafting treasures with variety!

Designed for use with Dungeons & Dragons and similar systems.

boardgame.name: Uncle Gordo's House
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Uncle Gordo has died and left all his weird stuff to the young people he loved.

Nieces and nephews, both blood and adopted. Scruffy street rats he paid to mow his lawn. Paid assistants and the garage band who borrowed his garage. You have all met to clean up his house and sort out his estate, which is large and bizarre.

Uncle Gordo was an inventor, and he built strange machines, and they are everywhere.

And they are going to cause a lot of problems.

Uncle Gordo's House is a tabletop role playing game suitable for digital or analog play

Logistics:
Participants: 2-5
Time: 2 hours
Content warnings: Death, weird machines, young people, danger

boardgame.name: Shipwreck Island: 5-6 Player Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
This expansion will allow two more players to added your existing Shipwreck Island game board allowing up to 6 players at once. Expansion includes 2 Pawns, 60 Wall Segment Pieces, 4 Fire markers, 10 Reinforcement Cards, and 2 Game Play Instruction cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fortifications of Moroni: 5-6 Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion will allow up to 6 players to play with your original 2-4 player copy of Fortifications of Moroni. Expansion includes 2 Pawns, 60 Wall Segment Pieces, 4 Fire markers, 10 Reinforcement Cards, and 2 Game Play Instruction cards.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Fortifications of Moroni: 8 Player Expansion Pack
